com.yantra.api.wms.containerization

Interface containerizeWave

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface containerizeWave

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document containerizeWave(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The containerizeWave API is used to containerize and generate SCM labels for all shipment lines belonging to a Wave at a specific node.

    • Method Detail

      • containerizeWave

        org.w3c.dom.Document containerizeWave(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException

        The containerizeWave API is used to containerize and generate SCM labels for all shipment lines belonging to a Wave at a specific node. The PickStrategy flag on the task type determines whether containerization is required or not. Based on the Task Type configuration, all the tasks that are part of a Wave are processed either for system suggested containerization or for the generation of SCM labels.The generation of SCM labels is driven based on the Pack constraints configuration that has been set up at the BuyerOrganization level and at the Node-Enterprise level.

        The containerization of loose sku's(Volume Based)can be summarized as:

        1. Fetch all tasks that require loose containerization(this is determined by the task type on the task).
        2. For the tasks that were retrieved, form SKU Groups based on Task Type, Shipment No and Container Category (Item Classification Code).
        3. Based on the Do Not Mix constraints defined at the buyer and node-enterprise level, the SKU groups that are formed might have to be split further.
        4. For each SKU group, get a list of containers that are applicable for the buyer organization on the shipment.
        5. Try to place the SKU's that are part of each SKU group in the available containers such that we do not violate any Volume , Weight and Dimension constraints that have been configured for the container.
        6. Once we have determined the number of containers that are needed and the placement of SKU's inside the containers, we will create shipment containers on our system and stamp the shipment container key on the tasks.

        The generation of SCM labels is driven by the Pack Constraints configuration. If SCM generation is configured to be system generated, then we will generate SCM labels either for only cases, or for cases and pallets based on the configuration.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSOverrideSuggestedContainerListUE
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSCircumventLooseContainerizationUE
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSOverrideContainerizationCategoryUE
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetOverridenAttributesForShipmentLineItemUE

        Events Raised:
        ON_SUCCESS.

          WMS_CONTAINERIZE_WAVE.ON_SUCCESS is called if wave has been successfully containerized.

        HAS_EXCEPTIONS.
        Shipments may contain items that cannot be containerized using any of the available standard containers. Such Items are assigned dummy containers instead of the standard ones. Shipments containing such items are published on this event.
        Data published - WMS_CONTAINERIZE_WAVE.HAS_EXCEPTIONS.xml

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        An XML document. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
